final_kcs.content_element: Applying the perimeter formula to set up an equation with a known perimeter and height, and an unknown width.

final_kcs.content_element: Recognizing the structure of the perimeter formula for a rectangle as P = 2(l + w) or P = 2l + 2w, where P is the perimeter, l is the length, and w is the width.
final_kcs.learning_outcome: Students will be able to identify the components of the perimeter formula and their relationship to the dimensions of a rectangle.

final_kcs.content_element: Analyzing the relationship between variables in a mathematical formula to understand how changes in one variable affect others.

final_kcs.content_element: Recognizing the perimeter formula for a rectangle as 2 * (length + width) or 2 * length + 2 * width.
final_kcs.learning_outcome: Students will be able to recall the perimeter formula for a rectangle.

final_kcs.content_element: Recognizing and classifying geometric shapes, specifically identifying a hexagonal pyramid.

A hexagonal pyramid has a hexagon as its base and triangles connecting each side of the hexagon to a single point at the top, called the apex.
